text.headline: File Validation
text.text: Verify chapter index.md exists with required structure. This initial validation ensures all necessary files are in place before proceeding with content generation.

events.notes: Duration: < 1 second. Checks for file existence, basic structure, and required frontmatter fields.

text.headline: Structure Check
text.text: Parse and validate title, summary, concepts list, prerequisites. Ensures all structural elements meet requirements for automated content generation.

events.notes: Duration: 1-2 seconds. Validates YAML frontmatter, concept list format, and dependency structure.

text.headline: Reading Level Analysis
text.text: Extract target audience from course description and determine appropriate complexity. Analyzes course metadata to set appropriate vocabulary, sentence structure, and explanation depth.

events.notes: Duration: 2-3 seconds. Determines reading level (junior-high, senior-high, college, graduate) from course description and prerequisites.

text.headline: Reference Loading
text.text: Load reading-level guidelines and content-element-types specifications. Retrieves template files, style guides, and educational frameworks to ensure content quality and consistency.

events.notes: Duration: 3-5 seconds. Loads Bloom's Taxonomy mappings, ISO 11179 standards, content templates, and MicroSim specifications.

text.headline: Content Generation
text.text: Generate detailed educational content with examples, exercises, and non-text elements. This is the core phase where AI creates comprehensive chapter content including worked examples, practice exercises, diagrams, and MicroSim specifications.

events.notes: Duration: 60-180 seconds (varies by chapter length). Token usage: 10,000-50,000 tokens depending on concept count and content depth.

text.headline: Concept Coverage Verification
text.text: Cross-check generated content against concept list for completeness. Ensures every concept from the learning graph is adequately explained with examples and exercises.

events.notes: Duration: 5-10 seconds. Scans generated content for mentions of each concept, verifies definitions, examples, and practice problems exist.

text.headline: File Update
text.text: Replace TODO placeholder with generated content in index.md. Writes the final content to the chapter file, preserving frontmatter and structure.

events.notes: Duration: 1-2 seconds. Uses atomic write operations to prevent data loss, maintains backups of previous versions.

text.headline: Reporting
text.text: Generate summary statistics (word count, elements, concepts covered). Creates a comprehensive report showing content metrics, quality indicators, and completion status.

events.notes: Duration: 2-3 seconds. Reports: word count, reading level metrics, diagram count, exercise count, concept coverage percentage, estimated reading time.
